channel.title: GF laptop?
channel.description:
Hey,
Ok, so for some weird reason, my laptop screen turned blue and said something about finding too much memory and I only had a download going. So I restarter the damn thing and it said re install these files listed above. And the. It just shut off. Turned it on again, and it just gave me a black screen. Does anyone know if my laptop is done, or I just need to re install files. Either way I'll be pissed cause of all my Photoshop shit and everything else :( help? :o

item.title: GF laptop?
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:10, topic:410010”]Motherboard issue, if it’s under warranty try and get it repaired? Or look inside for yourself if you think you can.[/quote]This thing is fucking ancient. Don’t think it has a warranty anymore

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:11, topic:410010”]Try opening it up and vacuuming it out, like Muroth said it could be the mother bored if it over heated or maybe from a drop.[/quote]If it is a part problem, I’m just getting a new laptop. Last year I had to replace the hard drive… So not wasting my money again!

Read full topic

item.title: GF laptop?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Try opening it up and vacuuming it out, like Muroth said it could be the mother bored if it over heated or maybe from a drop.

Read full topic

Motherboard issue, if it’s under warranty try and get it repaired? Or look inside for yourself if you think you can.

item.title: GF laptop?
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

runewings317:

I don’t download shit utill I know it’s safe. Which is the main reason I let people work with sources for at least 3 days before I download. And the download wasn’t complete.

Do any lights blink when you’re turning them on?

Read full topic

item.title: GF laptop?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Find a USB drive (external hdd, thumb drive, any will do) and (you will need a second computer) make a Ubuntu live CD. Backup what files you can (if you can) and then just re-install your OS.

Read full topic

item.title: GF laptop?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Muroth:

Backup and reinstall your OS.

He said he couldn’t even get into his laptop, just a black screen and turns off.

Read full topic

item.title: GF laptop?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Sounds like you downloaded a diver over loader, basically people make them not to steal stuff but just to be annoying. In most cases you just have to delete the files on that drive and re install your OS but in some bad cases the drive could be burned past use.

Read full topic

item.title: GF laptop?
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

That sounds like a hard drive and/or RAM problem. You could have possibly deleted something that runs your OS. If worse comes to worst, reinstall your OS. If your motherboard is fried, then GF.

Read full topic
